title.narrative: Livestock-Based livelihood support to cyclone affected communities in Baki and Zeila districts of Awdal region, Somaliland

description.narrative:
To contribute to recovery and promote resilience of the target communities from the loss of livelihood assets, Candlelight will distribute 5000 goats and sheep to improve household nutrition and rebuild livelihood of vulnerable communities in Baki and Zeilac districts of Awdal region of Somaliland. Atleast 415 vulnerable households (Approximately 3000 individuals) including women headed households, the elderly, sick and displaced will be selected for assistance together with the community elders. This project is part of efforts to restore livelihoods and combat critical levels of food insecurity and malnutrition in areas affected by the cyclone sagar. These shocks led to loss of livelihood assets and triggered the displacement of many people in the region.
The shoats will be procured locally through a tendering process. This will boost the local economy. Distributions will target both pastoral and agro-pastoral households with each household receiving 10 animals (9 lactating and 1 male). Animal restocking will be crucial for the benefit of women for whom goats play a major role for the household nutrition security through the provision of milk and a source of revenue to address other household challenges. For purposes of sustainability, Candlelight project staff will ensure that goats distributed meet specifications of good health, weight and breeding performance. This will contribute to sustainability and provide long term livelihood support to communities
The goats will be complimented by Unconditional Cash transfer to the 415 households for a period of 3 months. The rates of 80 USD are based on the cash working group rates for full Minimum Expenditure Basket (MEB) as published in September 2018. These may however slightly change up/ downwards. Part of the cash will be used for food and the balance used for non-food items including the care and maintenance of the restocked animals for initial three-four months.
Candlelight will also work with FAO to secure supplements blocks for the distributed animals. Each household will be provided with atleast 10 kg of feeds. Distribution of these supplementary blocks will be based on availability from FAO
Candlelight will also distribute atleast 5000 multi-purpose tress such as Ziziphus mauritiana (Gob), azadirachta indica (Neem) and Leucaena Leucocephala (Leucaena). These trees will provide fodder for the goats, living fence posts for gardens, fruits among other uses.
